intro: Begonia bangii, commonly known as the silver velvet begonia, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that range in color from deep green to silvery white. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of pink or white, which bloom in spring. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
